Are there arbitrarily long arithmetic progressions of primes?



The answer is yes, proved by Green and Tao \cite{GrTa08}. The stronger claim that there are arbitrarily long arithmetic progressions of consecutive primes is still open.

See also [3] and [141].

This is discussed in problem A5 of Guy's collection \cite{Gu04}.




References


[GrTa08] Green, Ben and Tao, Terence, The primes contain arbitrarily long arithmetic progressions. Ann. of Math. (2) (2008), 481-547.

[Gu04] Guy, Richard K., Unsolved problems in number theory. (2004), xviii+437.
